description: {"blocks":[{"key":"5j8lt","text":"The purpose of this extraction protocol is to prepare a DNA sample for later pipeline processing, such as our GT-seq protocol EFGL, SANGER Sequencing EFGL, or RADSeq protocol EFGL. DNA extraction at EFGL occurs via tissue sampling (usually from fin clips in ethanol vials, coin envelopes, or on Whatman sheets), a Proteinase K digestion, then the solution is filtered through a Nexttec Cleanplate. Upon completion of this protocol you will have a lysate solution that contains accessible DNA for amplification and sequencing. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
keywords: GT-seq protocol EFGL,SANGER Sequencing EFGL,RADSeq protocol EFGL,DNA Extraction

{"blocks":[{"key":"fua1t","text":"Inspect deep-well plate for cracks or breaks (notify Lab Manager if damage is found) and label the side of your deep-well plate with basic information – this plate will be thrown away in the end so enough info that we know which plate it is and who is working on it. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"21qnp","text":"Suggested: Project Name, Tray #, Date, and Initials","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"13q1u","text":"Prepare your deep-well plate for extraction.  Pour ~  of Buffer G into the reservoir per plate. Using your 8-channel pipette, a set of tips and the reservoir, put   of Buffer G into EACH WELL of deep-well plate. (You may use one 8-channel set of tips for the whole plate as the plate is sterile and contamination is not yet a concern.) ","type":"ordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":159,"length":32}],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":52,"length":1},{"key":1,"offset":163,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"audg6","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"amount","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"amount":"8","error":false,"guid":"","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":2}},"1":{"type":"amount","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"amount":"70","error":false,"guid":"","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":1}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"dj362","text":"      Deposit tissue into deep well plate","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"6665h","text":"          a. If samples are on vacuum-sealed Whatman sheets, open such that we can re-seal the     ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"fr41g","text":"              plastic instead of making a new vacuum pouch, if possible. Place Whatman sheet on top of your ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"4h1bl","text":"              mat and use your punch tool with 3.0mm tip to punch a sample from the appropriate cell of the ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":47,"length":5}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"380pf","text":"              Whatman sheet and press plunger down on the end of the tool to deposit the Whatman + fin clip               ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"aagoo","text":"              into the appropriate well of your plate. If the fin clip is taped onto the sheet, you can punch ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"csgli","text":"              through the tape. No need to remove it. Rinse all tools with ethanol and blot dry BETWEEN EACH ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":96,"length":13}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"3f0f5","text":"                  SAMPLE. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":24}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"8gcdl","text":"NOTE!: If the fin clip comes off of the sheet, Scotch tape it back on, in the correct cell. Skip to c.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":6}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"1oeq8","text":"          b. If samples are in vials, array the sample vials into a vial rack according to your Extraction Map.  ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"3ld44","text":"              Orient your vial racks and deep well plate by the A1 corner. Pull the vial/envelope and remove ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"2ljh","text":"              tissue with forceps, snip off tissue with scissors roughly the size of this letter ‘O’. Make sure to ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"21m0g","text":"              thoroughly blot fin clips with a Kim Wipe to remove ethanol.  Place the tissue into the deep-well ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"56dso","text":"              tray. Place remainder of tissue back into vial, seal and put it back in the vial rack in its correct ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"45fog","text":"              space. Rinse all tools with ethanol and blot dry BETWEEN EACH SAMPLE.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":63,"length":19}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"b4na9","text":"NOTE!: Mark an ‘X’ at top of vials if they are completely out.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":6}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"egkac","text":"          c.  Make notes of any sample issues on the extraction sheet, such as dried up vial, sample used up ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"5jr6i","text":"              (uu), small sample (ss) or brittle tissue, etc.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"20utl","text":"Repeat step 4 until the whole tray is extracted - typically 95 samples. DOUBLE CHECK to make sure each well has a tissue sample (the No Template Control (NTC) well should not contain a sample).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":72,"length":12}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"ck20i","text":"Open a new box of p10 pipette tips. Using your 8-channel pipette, dispense   of Pro-K into each well of the deep-well plate containing your tissue and the NTC well. DISCARD tips after each row to avoid CONTAMINATION. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":165,"length":52}],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":75,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"9lnp1","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"amount","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"amount":"10","error":false,"guid":"","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":1}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"54vls","text":"Seal up your deep well plate with a heat seal, silver side down. IT IS VERY IMPORTANT to get a good seal on the plate.  Evaporation can occur in the outermost wells.  You can also use either small strips of foil seal or lab tape to create an extra seal on the edges of the extraction plate.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":65,"length":53}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"80h01","text":"          a. Place heat sealing foil (heat seal) white side up on the tray. Try and get best coverage possible.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"b9v49","text":"          b. Place tray on heat press and press down firmly for  to   ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":64,"length":1},{"key":1,"offset":68,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"d93m7","text":"          c. Release, rotate tray, and repeat press","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"f5s21","text":"          d. Remove array tray from heat press and enforce seal with brayer (roller) or fingers","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"duration","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"duration":5,"guid":"","id":0,"label":"","pause":null,"preset":[],"start":null}},"1":{"type":"duration","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"duration":6,"guid":"","id":0,"label":"","pause":null,"preset":[],"start":null}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"de0j0","text":"Remove and place tray in incubator for a minimum of   to , preferably overnight. {"blocks":[{"key":"6f2ve","text":"NOTE: You can do this step at any point before now and store the tray in the refrigerator until needed - overnight to 1 week.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"italic","offset":0,"length":125}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"eco3","text":"Gather the items you need to do your FILTER TRAY","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"150rs","text":"          a. Nexttec Cleanplate (filter tray) (Cat. #: 10924-F-NX)","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"105qc","text":"          b. Prep Buffer (Cat. #: 10924-F-NX) - in refrigerator","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"b4li1","text":"          c.  falcon tube","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":13,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"6frvr","text":"          d. Skirted PCR Plate (array tray)","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"d9cg6","text":"          e. Repeating pipette","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"4jbch","text":"          f.    combi-tip for repeater pipette","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":1,"offset":14,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"apcai","text":"          g. Nexttec Sealing Tape (clear plastic seal)","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"59hp9","text":"          h. Gloves","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"amount","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"amount":"50","error":false,"guid":"","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":2}},"1":{"type":"amount","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"amount":"5","error":false,"guid":"","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":2}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"d4p4q","text":"Unwrap the Cleanplate (filter tray) from its plastic wrap and inspect for cracks or breaks. If they have a yellow hue they might not heat seal correctly. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"23eac","text":"Pour roughly   of Prep buffer into a   falcon tube","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":13,"length":1},{"key":1,"offset":37,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"8p431","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"amount","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"amount":"35","error":false,"guid":"","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":2}},"1":{"type":"amount","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"amount":"50","error":false,"guid":"","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":2}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"3hjoh","text":"Dispense   into each well of the filter tray assembly using a   combi-tip and a repeater pipette. (After drawing Prep Buffer into the combi-tip, the read out will be blinking. Dispense one time into falcon tube before dispensing into filter tray. This calibrates the repeater.) Repeat until all wells in the filter plate have Prep Buffer. (One fill of the combi-tip will dispense into ~14 wells.)","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":98,"length":148},{"style":"bold","offset":247,"length":30}],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":9,"length":1},{"key":1,"offset":62,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"6t47v","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"amount","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"amount":"350","error":false,"guid":"","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":1}},"1":{"type":"amount","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"amount":"5","error":false,"guid":"","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":2}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"75c0m","text":"If you are fairly certain that you missed a well, refill it with   of the buffer.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":65,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"11u7h","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"amount","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"amount":"350","error":false,"guid":"","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":1}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"cp2qb","text":"Seal the plate with a Nexttec Sealing Tape (plastic seal), press by hand for a good seal.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"bmqvh","text":"Incubate at room temperature for  .","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":33,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"7ocan","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"duration","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"duration":300,"guid":"","id":0,"label":"","pause":null,"preset":[],"start":null}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"e0h6r","text":"Place filter tray assembly in centrifuge and spin at 2640 RPMs for  .","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":67,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"csi6r","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"duration","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"duration":60,"guid":"","id":0,"label":"","pause":null,"preset":[],"start":null}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"3vau2","text":"After spin down is complete, verify that EACH well contains Prep Buffer. If a well looks empty repeat steps 4-10 for any empty wells.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"8hqpm","text":"Place the filter plate on a LABELED, skirted PCR plate (label=Project Name, Tray #, Date, and Initials. See Step 5 for guidance) This plate will eventually be stored in the   freezer. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":173,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"7sgsd","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"temperature","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"error_temperature":false,"guid":"","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"temperature":"-80","unit":12}}}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"2n437","text":"Discard the deep-well plate containing the spun-down Prep Buffer ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"b4g0t","text":"If you are not using the prepped filter tray immediately, store it in refrigerator up to 1 week (preferably no longer than 1 day). ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"14mun","text":"Gather the items you need to do your FINAL PREP","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"djcgu","text":"          a. Your extraction tray (from incubator)","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"ch2v7","text":"          b. Your prepared Nexttec Cleanplate filter tray assembly from step 3","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"cqukf","text":"          c. A multi-channel   to   pipette and full box of tips","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":29,"length":1},{"key":1,"offset":34,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"ar9m","text":"          d. Nexttec sealing tape (clear plastic seal)","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"7tpdl","text":"          e. Thermo heat sealing foil (heat seal)","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"asf6h","text":"          f.  Gloves","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"amount","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"amount":"10","error":false,"guid":"","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":1}},"1":{"type":"amount","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"amount":"100","error":false,"guid":"","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":1}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"9in5o","text":"Retrieve your extraction tray from the incubator and spin at 3000 RPMs for  .","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":75,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"ef016","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"duration","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"duration":60,"guid":"","id":0,"label":"","pause":null,"preset":[],"start":null}}}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"129p4","text":"Remove aluminum seal or heat seal from extraction tray.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"ibh6","text":"Remove plastic seal from filter tray, but save it for later.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"2o0ac","text":"Set your 8-channel pipette to   and transfer all of lysate solution from extraction tray wells into the corresponding filter tray wells. DISCARD tips after each use.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":137,"length":28}],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":30,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"6dnhi","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"amount","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"amount":"80","error":false,"guid":"","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":1}}}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"frm75","text":"Seal filter tray with clear plastic seal from earlier","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"dqsl1","text":"Let the filter tray incubate at room temperature for  .","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":53,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"a1nph","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"duration","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"duration":180,"guid":"","id":0,"label":"","pause":null,"preset":[],"start":null}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"1g4po","text":"Place in centrifuge at 2640 RPMs for  , balance if needed.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":37,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"8stbh","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"duration","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"duration":60,"guid":"","id":0,"label":"","pause":null,"preset":[],"start":null}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"b1oml","text":" Check to make sure liquid has gone from top, through the filter into the labeled skirted PCR plate. You should see lysate solution in each well. THERE SHOULD BE AN EQUAL AMOUNT OF LIQUID IN ALL WELLS WITH A SAMPLE AND THE NTC. THIS IS THE DNA TRAY SAVED FOR OUR ARCHIVES. IF IT DOESN’T LOOK RIGHT (EMPTY WELLS OR UNEVEN LEVELS BETWEEN WELLS, NEED TO TROUBLESHOOT BEFORE CONTINUING)","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":1},{"style":"bold","offset":146,"length":236}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"5und9","text":"Heat seal plate","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"6lto9","text":"Store labeled array tray in fridge.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"a7pu3","text":"Below is an example of how to properly label the array trays for work in the lab and for storage in the   freezers at the completion of a project.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":104,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"21qhj","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"temperature","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"error_temperature":false,"guid":"","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"temperature":"-80","unit":12}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"ffonp","text":"The tray front (side below row H) needs to have the following information written clearly:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"UNDERLINE","offset":82,"length":8}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"3a5c7","text":"a. Full project name (NO ABBREVIATIONS)","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"f5q14","text":"b. Extraction tray number","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"adrts","text":"c. Extraction date","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"718su","text":"d. Initials of the person who extracted the tray","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"cdf5j","text":"Before putting the array tray into a  freezer at the end of a project, the heat seal on top of the tray and the back skirt of the array tray should be labeled with the Progeny Container Name/-80 Tray Assignment Number.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":36,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"foul5","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"temperature","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"error_temperature":false,"guid":"","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"temperature":"-80","unit":12}}}}
